Class Arrays

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.ottokyosti.util.Arrays
public class Arrays extends Object
The class Arrays contains methods for handling different given arrays

    • toIntArray

      public static int[] toIntArray​(String[] array)
      The toIntArray method takes the String array given to it and converts it into Int array step by step.
      Parameters:
      array - the String array which will be converted to int array
      Returns:
      a converted array containing integers

    • contains

      public static boolean contains​(int value, int[] array)
      The contains method goes through given int array and checks if the given value is found in the array
      Parameters:
      value - given value to be compared to the array's numbers
      array - given array to be checked
      Returns:
      either true or false depending if give value is found in the array

    • containsSameValues

      public static int containsSameValues​(int[] array1, int[] array2)
      The containsSameValues method goes through two given int arrays and checks whether there are equal values present
      Parameters:
      array1 - the first array for the comparison
      array2 - the second array for the comparison
      Returns:
      a value indicating how many values were equal

    • populate

      public static int[] populate​(int[] numbers)
      The populate method gets an empty array as a parameter and populates it with numbers in ascending order
      Parameters:
      numbers - the integer array that will be populated
      Returns:
      an integer array with numbers in ascending order

    • removeIndex

      public static int[] removeIndex​(int[] numbers, int index)
      The removeIndex method gets an array and am integer value as parameters and creates a new array without the number from the original array using the given value
      Parameters:
      numbers - the original array from which the number will be removed
      index - the position from where the number will be removed from the array
      Returns:
      an array that is shorter by one in length compared to the original array and without the index value

    • bestOfAdd

      public static String[] bestOfAdd​(String[] bestOf, int howManyCorrect, int years)
      The bestOfAdd method gets it's parameters as String array to be added in, the index where the number will be added and the value which to add. I chose the array to be in String form, because an empty String array is populated with null-values. Because the parameter 'years' could be 0, there would not be a suitable if statement. We don't have to modify the String array after this.
      Parameters:
      bestOf - the String array that will be modified
      howManyCorrect - the value that points the index from the array
      years - the value that will be added to the index place in the array
      Returns:
      the String array with a value in it's specified index

    • sort

      public static int[] sort​(int[] array)
      The sort method gets an array as it's parameter and sorts it using selection sort
      Parameters:
      array - an array which you want to sort
      Returns:
      an array that is sorted from smallest to largest number

    • printArray

      public static void printArray​(int[] array, int turnDecider)
      The printArray method gets an array as it's parameter and prints it
      Parameters:
      array - the array from where you want to print the numbers
      turnDecider - the value that determines which prefix ('User lotto' or 'Random lotto') is used in printing
